basic_datapoints.quiz_title: The week that was in business
basic_datapoints.introduction: This will be a definitive week for Aadhar, with its hearing in the Supreme Court. Already much has been written and spoken about its use. How much can you remember?

questions.question: What is the maximum charge for Aadhaar services?

options.fact: BINGO. This is the maximum amount you need to pay to avail Aadhaar ServiceAn update of either biometric or demographic details requires the aadhaar card holder to pay Rs 25
No, this is not the maximum charge.An update of either biometric or demographic details requires the aadhaar card holder to pay Rs 25
No, this is not the maximum charge. An update of either biometric or demographic details requires the aadhaar card holder to pay Rs 25

questions.question: When was the concept of unique identity first discussed?

options.fact: Ops! Missed it by a year.The concept of unique identity was first discussed when the Department of Information Technology, Ministry of Communications and Information Technology gave approval for the project â€œUnique IDâ€ for BPL families on March 3, 2006

No, you're a little late. The concept of unique identity was first discussed when the Department of Information Technology, Ministry of Communications and Information Technology gave approval for the project â€œUnique IDâ€ for BPL families on March 3, 2007

Perfect! That's eaxctly when the discussion started. The concept of unique identity was first discussed when the Department of Information Technology, Ministry of Communications and Information Technology gave approval for the project â€œUnique IDâ€ for BPL families on March 3, 2008

Oh no, they were discussing about identity numbers but not about Aadhaar. The concept of unique identity was first discussed when the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology gave approval for the project â€œUnique IDâ€ for BPL families on March 3, 2009

questions.question: Aadhaar card has the following details:

options.fact: No, they have yourt biometric data too.
No, they have your demographic data as well.
Absolutely correct!Aadhaar card has demographic as well as biometric data of an individual

questions.question: Benefits under the Aadhaar-enabled schemes can be denied to an individual if he/she does not have Aadhaar.

options.fact: No one can deny you benefits if you do not have Aadhaar. Aadhaar Act states that if subsidy is given from Consolidated Fund of India then beneficiary must have Aadhaar. If they do not, then they must enroll for it and until then alternative means of identification can be used.

Correct!. Section 7 of the Aadhaar Act states that if subsidy is given from Consolidated Fund of India then beneficiary must have Aadhaar. If they do not, then they must enroll for Aadhaar and until then alternative means of identification can be used.

questions.question: You can cast a vote using Aadhaar.

options.fact: Not yet. Voter ID is mandatory for casting a vote. One cannot vote using Aadhaar
Absolutely right!Voter ID is mandatory for casting a vote. One cannot vote using Aadhaar
No problem. Here's the answer: No, you cannot vote using Aadhaar.Voter ID is mandatory for casting a vote. One cannot vote using Aadhaar

questions.question: Recently, Aadhaar was challenged in Supreme Court because it violated this Right.

options.fact: Close, but no. On July 12, the Supreme Court agreed to hear all the issues arising out of Aadhar card, especially the concern over whether it breaches the people's right to privacy. SC said that right to privacy is â€˜not absoluteâ€™.

Correct! On July 12, the Supreme Court agreed to hear all the issues arising out of Aadhar card, especially the concern over whether it breaches the people's right to privacy. SC said that right to privacy is â€˜not absoluteâ€™.

Nope, it did not challenge our fundamental right of freedom.On July 12, the Supreme Court agreed to hear all the issues arising out of Aadhar card, especially the concern over whether it breaches the people's right to privacy. SC said that right to privacy is â€˜not absoluteâ€™.

Ops! Wrong answer.On July 12, the Supreme Court agreed to hear all the issues arising out of Aadhar card, especially the concern over whether it breaches the people's right to privacy. SC said that right to privacy is â€˜not absoluteâ€™.

questions.question: Government officials can rightfully use Aadhaar to track an individual.

options.fact: No.No one can track an individual using Aadhaar. Any attempt to track an individual through Aadhaar number is an offence under the Aadhaar Act.
Right.No one can track an individual using Aadhaar. Any attempt to track an individual through Aadhaar number is an offence under the Aadhaar Act.

questions.question: What is the tagline for Aadhaar?

options.fact: Correct!In 2016, the tagline â€˜Aam Admi ka Adhikarâ€™ was changed to â€˜Mera Aadhaar, Meri Pehchaanâ€™ following several requests to remove the phrase â€˜aam admiâ€™.

Well, this was the first tagline but it got changed. In 2016, the tagline â€˜Aam Admi ka Adhikarâ€™ was changed to â€˜Mera Aadhaar, Meri Pehchaanâ€™ following several requests to remove the phrase â€˜aam admiâ€™.
